item.title: Covid-19: More than 75% of UK adults now double-jabbed
item.description: But Oxford vaccine chief Prof Sir Andrew Pollard warns Covid herd immunity is "not a possibility".

item.title: Oxford-jab chief criticises UK's Covid booster plan
item.description: But the health secretary says he plans to begin their rollout in a matter of weeks.

item.title: A-level results 2021: Top grades reach record high
item.description: The second year of results after cancelled exams sees the highest level of A* and A grades at A-level.

item.title: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo resigns in wake of harassment report
item.description: Democrat Andrew Cuomo has resigned after an inquiry found he sexually harassed multiple women.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Missing hiker's boyfriend finds her body
item.description: The body and belongings of Esther Dingley are found close to where a bone fragment was discovered.

item.title: Covid-19: Three-quarters of UK adults fully jabbed and relief at record A-level results
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

item.title: Google lets parents remove children from image-search results
item.description: The search giant announces a range of changes to its children's policies on Google and YouTube.

item.title: Max Woosey: Camping challenge boy set for 500th night
item.description: Max Woosey will be spending the milestone night sleeping in a shelter in the woods.

item.title: David Cameron personally promoted Greensill to investors
item.description: BBC Panorama finds Mr Cameron appeared alongside the controversial company's founder at a 2019 event.

item.title: Smitten prison officer helped inmate lover escape
item.description: Erica Whittingham met prisoner Michael Seddon after her marriage broke down, a court hears.

item.title: Fenwick Colchester: Freddie Farrow, 5, died after being struck by a mirror
item.description: Freddie Farrow died days after being struck by a mirror in a High Street department store.

item.title: Storm Huntley thanks 'lucky stars' after bike accident
item.description: The Jeremy Vine show co-presenter says her helmet saved her when she was knocked down by a car.

item.title: Sheffield Link FM radio station faces sanction over 'Jihadi' chant
item.description: An Islamic chant "encouraging violent Jihad" was broadcast by Sheffield-based Link FM, Ofcom says.

item.title: A-level results: 'We've put in the work and we deserve these grades'
item.description: Students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland are told their A-level and BTec results.

item.title: Lithuania blames Belarus for migrant crisis
item.description: Over 4,000 people are reported to have crossed in Lithuania in recent months.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban seizure will challenge West - Gen Sir Nick Carter
item.description: The chief of the defence staff on difficulties ahead if the Taliban illegitimately seize control.

item.title: Nottinghamshire boxer, 64, ends career with world title win
item.description: Steve Ward, previously recognised as the world's oldest male boxer, secures his fairy tale ending.

item.title: England's top women snooker players return to the table
item.description: After an 18-month break due to coronavirus, England's top competitors are back on the baize.

item.title: TK Maxx store evacuated after rain causes ceiling collapse
item.description: Shopper Joanna McDonough captured footage of the dramatic incident in the Sauchiehall Street branch in Glasgow.

item.title: Has Banksy been on an East Anglian seaside 'spraycation'?
item.description: Are new murals that have appeared on England's east coast really the work of the elusive artist?

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca: Who is he and why has he hit the headlines?
item.description: The life of Geronimo the alpaca is at the centre of a row between his owner and the government.

item.title: Friends narrowly escape flooding lift
item.description: Three residents were caught in a storm surge in Omaha, Nebraska, and recorded their ordeal.

item.title: Fashion photographer: 'The world doesn't see this part of Afghanistan'
item.description: Fatimah Hossaini is a fashion photographer in Afghanistan and wants to use her work to help women be seen.

item.title: Baby loss: 'Our world grows around the grief'
item.description: Ross Coniam set up the Dads and Lads Network for men who have gone through baby loss.

item.title: Earth Photo 2021 winners announced
item.description: A project on family education wins the 2021 Earth Photo competition.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?

item.title: How TV's The Windsors is making its unregal stage debut
item.description: The creator and cast of the royal comedy satire take us behind the scenes of their West End show.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence drama 'celebrates common decency'
item.description: Steve Coogan says it was an honour to play the man who helped convict two men for the teen's murder.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: Messi agrees deal to sign for PSG - Balague
item.description: Lionel Messi agrees a two-year deal to join Paris St-Germain after leaving Barcelona, says BBC Sport columnist Guillem Balague.

item.title: England recall Moeen for second Test against India
item.description: Worcestershire all-rounder Moeen Ali is added to the England squad for the second Test against India at Lord's.

item.title: 'Messi feels betrayed' - The inside track on superstar's 'heartbreaking' Barca exit
item.description: Read the inside track on how Lionel Messi's Barcelona exit came about, with the club legend said to feel betrayed.

item.title: Sharma stars as Spirit win a tight finish to all-but eliminate Originals
item.description: An excellent all-round performance from Deepti Sharma helps London Spirit beat Manchester Originals in a fascinating back-and-forth game at Old Trafford.

item.title: GB's Hodgkinson sets sights on upgrading 800m silver for gold in Paris
item.description: Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson is determined to go one better than her 800m silver in Tokyo at the next Olympics in Paris.

item.title: The Hundred: Danielle Gibson dismisses Mignon du Preez with stunning catch
item.description: Watch as Dannielle Gibson pulls off a stunning catch for London Spirit to dismiss Manchester Originals' Mignon du Preez in The Hundred at Old Trafford.

item.title: A-level results: Teenage refugee can finally pursue medicine dream
item.description: Zainab Fadhal, who moved to the UK from Iraq, will join the University of Leeds in September.

item.title: A-levels 2021: What you need to know about this year's results
item.description: For the second year running, pupils in England, Wales and Northern Ireland have not taken the exams.

item.title: Will universities make allowances for my year? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your A-Level results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: Highers and Nat 5s: Four things to look out for on results day
item.description: Pupils across Scotland receive confirmation of their Higher and National 5 grades.

item.title: BTec results 2021: What are they and when are results out?
item.description: When will BTec results be out and how will the grades be reached?

item.title: How A Level and GCSE results are calculated
item.description: Education editor Branwen Jeffreys explains how grades are calculated and how you can appeal.

item.title: Exams 2021: 'Will they take our Covid grades seriously?'
item.description: It's been a stressful few months for the thousands of young people waiting for their exam results.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing in Wales, Scotland, England and Northern Ireland
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England, Scotland and Wales but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.
